reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having travelled in Surrey for twenty years, I knew that the Travelodge A25 Dorking was an idela base to watch the Olympic Road Race, July 2012, however the reality of the hotel was somewhat dissapointing.
reviews.title: A good base for Olympic cyclying but...

reviews.text: We arrived to a warm welcome from the receptionist and were giving our key; our family room was a good size, but could have been cleaner. There were suspicious marks on the curtains and sofa and also a hand print on the wall. The bathroom, although looking clean did smell a litttle and the bathroom door would not shut. However the towel were very nice and clean and fluffy!
reviews.title: Cheap but not very cheerful!
What an ugly building!
reviews.text: Our least favourite moment was being promised our breakfast packs at 0800 and both mornings we had to chase them up (in fact the first morning I went and collected them and the second morning they were bought to our door after a phone call!)
For the inflated price of £96 per night over the Olympic weekend we thought the room was very poor value. AT £19.99 per night you would put up with all the issues above.
reviews.title: Same as usual

reviews.text: From the key fob with a new number sellotaped on, to the broken loo seat, to the drill holes in the counter top and the mat of hairs in the overflow - the Travelodge failed to impress. It was good value and a convenient location but with a bit of effort we could have been left with a positive impression rather than dissapointment. We tried their breakfast box for around £4 per person - again it was just ok - a missed opportunity to impress.
reviews.title: Good place to explore the area from

reviews.text: Stayed for one night as a couple in December. The rooms are basic and clean but we didn't expect anything more for the price we paid. Mattress was a bit soft and probably needed replacing as did the sofa bed that looked a bit worn out. Booking in and out was very easy. Good location for Dorking town centre which is a ten minute walk away. overall excellent value for the money.
reviews.title: Very good value.

reviews.text: We stayed at this Travelodge last week and were very pleased with the quality and cleanliness of our room and the comfortable beds, the staff were also helpful and welcoming, and the cost of our stay was very good value for money.
reviews.title: Nice clean room and excellent value

reviews.text: I often stay at another Travelodge in west London which is brand new and only just opened, but our room and experience in Dorking was every bit as good. It appears from some of the reviews on this site that there might be some rooms at the Travelodge that need improvement, but I’m please to say our room was excellent and I would be happy to stay again.
reviews.title: Shabby!

reviews.text: I’d also like to mention that the Travelodge is only a short distance from the town centre and there is a Frankie and Benny’s restaurant next door which provides a varied menu which also caters well for children.
reviews.title: Basic

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night whilst on business. Was allocated a disabled room, not quite sure why but perhaps they were busy. That wasn't really a problem if the room was suitable for able bodied guests. I had to ask for linen and pillows. There was no chair in the room, the remote control for the tv wasn't working unless you were about two inches away from the screen. The room on the whole was shabby and in desperate need of a revamp and a good deep clean, whilst it is cheap it should still be clean and of a reasonable standard. As a female guest it is important that the curtains close especially as it was ground floor. Try as I may, despite spending ten minutes stood on the bed persuading the curtains to draw, they were not having any of it!
reviews.title: need new beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here when attending a local wedding evening reception, 1 night only. Average hotel, carpet in room not overly clean, noisy in the morning.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: The man that was on reception after 11pm who let us in was very friendly.
reviews.title: This Travelodge needs a refurb

reviews.text: We stayed here to attend a 40th birthday party nearby and have a mixed view of its facilities. It is one of the more dilapidated Travelodges and as such is probably less than average in relation to its facilities and the state of its public areas and rooms. for £59, it was poor value for money really as there isn't even free wifi (and of course almost no 3G signal either). The bed was too soft although after a few drinks I did not have any problem sleeping. However, the room heater did not work and while I like a cool room the friend with whom I was sharing was very cold and ended up having very little sleep until she wrapped herself in the spare quilt. We did find the staff helpful though and they even ordered us a taxi when the one we had pre-booked did not turn up. I would avoid it to be honest until it has been done up.
reviews.title: Does the job!
Not good
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night in a family room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was a good size room, but we didnt have a duvet for the single bed so I had to go and ask for one. Other than that, a good sleep very quite and comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used this hotel as a pre-flight stop-over and, as such, it fitted the bill very well. Its difficult to criticise at £19/night. The room was clean and of adequate size. The staff were consistently polite and good humoured. the TV was good properly tuned in for a change although the WIFI was overpriced. The adjacent Ben and Jerrys is now closed. Just a short run to Gatwick.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the 4-5 inch snow we had no problems.
reviews.title: Convenient for Gatwick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 1 night en route to Gatwick. The room was very good, clean and with a good TV. We had our own electric heater and the en suite was also clean and functioned well. On the down side, the shower was only tepid (I like a hot shower in the mornings) whilst the adjacent basin hot tap was HOT! The bed was far too soft for our liking and as a result we had a broken nights sleep. Having said all this we paid £18 for the room by advance purchase without breakfast and it was really good value. Dorking centre is only 5-10 minutes walk away so we ate there and walked back as the Frankie & Bennies adjacent resturant was closed.
reviews.title: Cheap but not cheerful

reviews.text: One more minus was the on site wi-fi, it was £5 for 1 hour and £10 for 24 hours. All we wanted was 10 minutes on line to check our emails and we did not think that spending £5 for that priviledge was good value. To be even handed, as we checked in and went to our room on the first floor, we noticed lumps of fresh earth on the landing & stair carpet, left there by some inconsiderate guest who had just checked in ahead of us. We informed reception and within 5 minutes the vacum cleaner was out and the carpets were restored to pristine condition.
reviews.title: Basic overnight accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I stay there again, probably yes as it represents good value for money and only 55 minutes driving from Gatwick.
reviews.title: Convenient for gatwick
